segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven principles that prevent decline.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha … pe ….
Katame ca, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
segments.en: And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?

segments.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū aniccasaññaṃ bhāvessanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
segments.en: As long as the mendicants develop the perception of impermanence …

segments.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anattasaññaṃ bhāvessanti … pe …

vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu, bhikkhū sandississanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
segments.en: they can expect growth, not decline. As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”
